s.text: Both papers quote Sweeney saying, "Because their fight is our fight, we are making this strike our strike."
UPS chairman James Kelly responded with the warning that a two-week strike could mean the layoff of 15,000 union workers and once again called for President Clinton to intervene.
Both papers quote Sweeney saying, "Because their fight is our fight, we are making this strike our strike."
UPS chairman James Kelly responded with the warning that a two-week strike could mean the layoff of 15,000 union workers and once again called for President Clinton to intervene.
The New York Times and Los Angeles Times lead with the AFL-CIO's open-ended loan to the Teamsters to help during the UPS strike.
UPS chairman James Kelly responded with the warning that a two-week strike could mean the layoff of 15,000 union workers and once again called for President Clinton to intervene.
The NYT reports that UPS is losing between $30-$50 million a day, and the LAT says the dispute "is on its way to becoming the biggest and costliest strike in a generation."
UPS chairman James Kelly responded with the warning that a two-week strike could mean the layoff of 15,000 union workers and once again called for President Clinton to intervene.
The Post welfare piece includes this statement made yesterday by President Clinton: "But a year later, I think it's fair to say the debate is over.
